page.title: 07ISLINGTON'S HOUSING CONTRAST
page.content: I have lived in Islington for a year now,and go to a mixed comprehensive school.This piece describes the contrast in areas in Islington, the houses,the people. This contrast will be everywhere across England, but it is especially concentrated in Islington. Around my school there are several estates. Some are broken down areas,the sort where it is not safe at night. These flats are boardered by well kept l9th century terraced houses, in court- yards and squares.Within a few streets the cost of property can go up, and the environment drastically change.I think the attraction of moving to Islington for many wealthier people is that it is near to the City and the West End.It is somehow quite horrifying that even within areas we have created even smaller areas and class groups.
